alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 15 at 9:36PM CST until January 17 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow and sleet accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills are expected through the warning period, with only a brief period of improvement possible Tuesday afternoon. Wind chills as low as 10 to 15 below zero. * WHERE...In Alabama, Lawrence, Limestone and Madison counties. In Tennessee, Franklin county. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 AM CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 9 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
